html:
9.9.22  11:42 am   what chapter of your life do you say you're in right now

      chapter.....5

9.9.22  9:22 am   Does the world make sense?

      yes, right when you least expect

9.9.22  7:57 am   whats your opinion on sausages

      they are somehow too long and too short at the same time

9.9.22  5:47 am   How did you come up with the idea for "I'm a Princess"?

     just sort of a "what if" situation, i suppose

     It's one of my favourite songs that you've made and I would like to know more about it.

     i wrote it way too fast, because i was actually determined to get onto a 1 song per week schedule (instead of 2 weeks, which was also failing at the time). so, in accordance with that, i wrote it extremely fast. too fast. later after i realized i would not be on pace to meet the 1-week goal, i also realized that the writing needed more work. even though i was most of the way through the production, i went back and did some re-writes. this is extremely rare. normally the writing is finalized before production begins. the riff/chorus used to be almost entirely instrumental (the "belong / message / lessons / before i'm gone" parts were added in the re-write). also the end of the bridge ("know what it's there for / here for" etc) was part of the re-write. the production was finished within a couple weeks after that, but then for some reason i decided to completely re-invent the graphics department from the ground up, so the finished audio of the song sat in limbo for many many months. which, for me, contributes to the haunting essence of the song

9.9.22  4:11 am   What do you do in a potential dream to know if you're dreaming?

     try to figure out the current date and time, and your geographical location. try to recount what you've done in the past week

      My thing is jumping

9.7.22  4:55 am   Do you have any tips on letting go of attachment to earthly desires

9.7.22  4:17 am   Do you have any advice for how to get from playing something like a 4-chord progression with all the chords in root position in just one hand to being able to voice them well across both hands like in actual songs? I've been having trouble trying to think of the notes of the next chord and then finding a good way to get to each of them from the notes of the current chord I'm playing quickly enough to not break rhythm

      get some songbooks (with chord symbols in them). then go through each of the songs (at any speed. stop as much as you want). and make a rule for yourself, of your highest and lowest note that you will be using in the chords. Maybe something like the first G below middle C, and the first A above middle C. Also allow yourself a bass note in a different range, how about between 1 and 2 C's below middle C. so each chord will have 1 note in the bass range, and... about 3 notes in the middle range. you're allowed to omit the bass note from the non-bass range. Then just go through the songbooks and find all the chords, in these ranges. you'll get used to all the patterns very quickly. you'll also start to enjoy the music much more because it will sound better

9.7.22  2:16 am   how do you learn a different language?

      immerse yourself in the actual world where that language is used most

9.7.22  1:50 am   how do I stop my apple from getting mad
